0.title: Video of Jhingan saying 'Played with women' after ISL match goes viral; clarifies
0.article_body: A video of ATK Mohun Bagan defender Sandesh Jhingan saying 'Played with women' after their 2-2 draw against Kerala Blasters in ISL went viral. Jhingan issued a clarification, tweeting, "I told my teammate not to make excuses...so anyone taking my comment differently is only doing it to tarnish my name." He further wrote, "If...my comments have hurt anyone...my apologies."

1.title: Amazon, Reliance to compete for IPL telecast rights for a record ₹50,000 cr: Report
1.article_body: Amazon and Reliance Industries are expected to take on Sony Group and Walt Disney's India units for exclusive five-year TV and digital broadcast rights of IPL, Reuters reported on Sunday. The cost to acquire these rights could run to a record ₹50,000 crore, the report added. Disney-owned Star India paid ₹16,348 crore in 2017 to have these rights until 2022.

2.title: We've to bring India on right path: Maharashtra CM on anti-BJP front
2.article_body: After meeting Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao to discuss an anti-BJP front, Maharashtra CM said, "We've to bring our country on the right path. Who [will be PM] can be discussed later." In an apparent criticism of BJP, he said, "Our Hindutva doesn't teach wrong politics. Some people only work for their agendas, even if the country goes to hell."

3.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against West Indies, make 4 changes
3.article_body: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in third T20I at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. India have made four changes to their playing XI, with Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Yuzvendra Chahal being replaced by Shreyas Iyer, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Avesh Khan and Shardul Thakur. Avesh is making his India debut.

4.title: BlackBerry 5G smartphone to no longer be made as startup behind it shuts down
4.article_body: OnwardMobility, the US-based company licensed to make new BlackBerry smartphones, has announced that it is shutting down. It confirmed that it will no longer be proceeding with the development of an ultra-secure BlackBerry 5G smartphone with a physical keyboard, which it had delayed earlier. "This was not a decision that we made lightly or in haste," OnwardMobility said.

5.title: Video shows rescue of 22 crew members after ship carrying luxury cars catches fire
5.article_body: The Portuguese Air Force released a video of how the 22 crew members onboard the ship carrying thousands of luxury cars were rescued after the vessel caught fire. The crew was lifted from Felicity Ace to an oil tanker before they were transported to Faial Island. Portugal's navy was quoted as saying that no one was hurt in the fire.

6.title: My Bat-Voice was atrocious, they told me to stop doing it: Robert
6.article_body: Actor Robert Pattinson, who will portray the titular superhero in upcoming film 'The Batman', has said that he tried to do something "radically different" with his Bat-Voice. "Everyone does this...gruff, gravelly thing, and I'm like, 'I'm going to...go really whispery'," the actor said. Robert added that it looked "absolutely atrocious" and was told to stop doing it after two weeks.

7.title: There'll be pressure on David when he plays for MI in IPL 2022: Watson
7.article_body: Talking about Tim David, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said there'll be pressure on the Singapore all-rounder when he plays for Mumbai Indians in IPL 2022. "It's not until you get into...game time when you really know how to absorb that pressure that's there," he added. The Singapore-born Australian was bought for ₹8.25 crore by MI in IPL 2022 mega auction.

8.title: Dalit groups hold protest in Bengaluru over Ambedkar photo row
8.article_body: Dalit groups held a massive protest march in Bengaluru on Saturday against a judge who objected to placing BR Ambedkar's portrait next to Mahatma Gandhi's on Republic Day in Raichur. The protestors demanded that the Karnataka district judge be suspended. The huge rally subsequently prompted Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to meet the protesters in Freedom Park and accept their memorandum.

9.title: People dumping garbage in public places to be fined ₹500 in Ghaziabad
9.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation will impose a ₹500 fine on people dumping garbage in public places, with about 200 staff having the power to penalise violators. The municipal authority plans to set up a plastic waste collection centre in each of the five zones of Ghaziabad by March. Ghaziabad generates about 1,200 metric tonnes of solid waste daily, a report said.

10.title: Mandaviya pays surprise visit to 'Jan Aushadhi Kendra' in Mumbai
10.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya conducted a surprise inspection of a 'Jan Aushadhi Kendra' in Mumbai on Sunday. These medical stores are locally known as 'Modi Ji ki shop', 'Modi Medical,' his official Twitter handle said. Mandaviya, who is on a two-day visit to Mumbai from Saturday, will conclude his visit at All India Institute of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation.

11.title: Passenger found alive in burning ferry off Greece
11.article_body: A passenger was found alive on the stern of a still burning passenger ferry off Greece, the Greek coast guard said on Sunday. At least 281 out of 292 passengers and crew have been rescued from the ferry since the fire began on Friday. Eleven people are still missing, according to the coast guard and the ferry operator.

12.title: Russia & Belarus extend joint military drills amid Ukraine tensions
12.article_body: Belarus said on Sunday that joint military exercises with Russia have been extended amid rising tensions in eastern Ukraine's Donbas region. Russia had deployed an estimated 30,000 troops in Belarus, which borders Ukraine to the north, for the drills that were supposed to conclude today. On Saturday, multiple explosions were heard in Donbas' Donetsk, a city controlled by pro-Russian separatists.

13.title: BEST's Chalo app for bus tickets now available for iPhone users
13.article_body: The BEST's Chalo App for Mumbai bus commuters, which was launched for Android users last year, has now been launched on the iOS platform as well. "Chalo App for BEST bus tickets, bus passes, live tracking and passenger capacity is available for iPhone users," the bus service announced on Twitter. The app also notifies users of route changes and diversions.

14.title: Actor Cezanne Khan to marry girlfriend Afsheen later this year
14.article_body: Actor Cezanne Khan, who portrayed Anurag Basu in the original 'Kasautii Zindagi Kay', has revealed that he will be marrying his girlfriend Afsheen later this year. "Had it not been for the pandemic, we would have been married by now," he added. Cezanne further said he was single until he met Afsheen and they have been together for three years.

15.title: Digital-asset universe can benefit from the 'crypto winter': Ethereum Co-Founder
15.article_body: Vitalik Buterin, the Co-Founder of the Ethereum blockchain, has said that the digital-asset universe can benefit from the 'crypto winter'. "The winters are the time when a lot of those applications fall away and you can see which projects are actually long-term sustainable," said Buterin. Crypto winter refers to a prolonged bearish period where asset prices fall over many months.

16.title: Pilot shares video from cockpit as he manages to land plane amid Storm Eunice in UK
16.article_body: A pilot filmed the moment from inside the cockpit when he maneuvered a plane amid the strong winds of Storm Eunice in the United Kingdom. Qatar Airways captain Khalifa Al-Thani shared a video of how he managed to land a flight that was travelling from Doha to London. "Must have nerves of steel," commented a user on his video.

17.title: UK's Queen Elizabeth tests positive for COVID-19 at 95
17.article_body: The UK's 95-year-old monarch Queen Elizabeth II has tested positive for COVID-19 and is experiencing mild, cold-like symptoms, Buckingham Palace said on Sunday. The Queen, who has received three doses of the COVID-19 vaccine, will continue with light duties, the Palace said. Her eldest son Prince Charles and daughter-in-law Camilla had recently contracted COVID-19.

18.title: Farhan, Hrithik dance to 'Senorita' at Farhan's wedding; video surfaces
18.article_body: Actors Farhan Akhtar and Hrithik Roshan danced to the song 'Senorita' from their film 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara' at Farhan Akhtar and anchor Shibani Dandekar's wedding. Farhan and Hrithik were seen recreating the original song's dance steps during the wedding celebrations. Farhan and Shibani got married on February 19 among close family and friends in a farmhouse in Khandala.

19.title: Gujarat Titans become 1st IPL team to launch their logo on Metaverse
19.article_body: Gujarat Titans have become the first Indian Premier League (IPL) team to launch their logo on Metaverse. Gujarat Titans shared a video on Instagram after the launch, wherein the avatars of Hardik Pandya, Ashish Nehra and Shubman Gill could be seen unveiling the logo. "Our DNA is about reaching the top," Hardik's avatar said while explaining the logo.

20.title: What is 'pig-butchering' crypto scam where fraudsters use romance to lure people?
20.article_body: Fraudsters are using the Chinese-origin 'pig-butchering' technique, a reference to how a target is "fattened up" before being butchered, for cryptocurrency scams. They develop long-term romantic relationships with targets on dating apps and social media to make them interested in cryptocurrency, forex and gold investments. They introduce the target to a sham investment website or app they control.

21.title: BigBasket acquires Kerala-based startup Agrima Infotech
21.article_body: BigBasket, a Tata enterprise, has acquired a Kerala-based startup Agrima Infotech, which was announced by BigBasket CEO Hari Menon on Saturday. BigBasket will utilise Agrima Infotech's customer vision technology platform, Psyight, at the self-checkout counters of its retail stores. Psyight helps identify all Indian fruits and vegetables uniquely from an image without using barcodes.

22.title: India's 1st Biosafety mobile lab to probe outbreaks opens in Nashik
22.article_body: Union Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare, Bharati Pravin Pawar on Friday inaugurated India's first Biosafety Level-3 mobile laboratory in Nashik. Reportedly, the lab will probe newly emerging and highly-infectious viral infections. Pawar added it will help in real-time data collection to facilitate quick containment of outbreaks. The lab is built at a cost of about ₹25 crore.

23.title: Ukraine will not respond to Russian provocations: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy
23.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said that his country would not respond to provocations amid threats of Russian invasion. He added that the reports that Ukraine has been shelling regions controlled by Moscow-backed separatists and inside the Russian border are "pure lies". Zelenskyy was addressing senior Western security officials at the annual Munich Security Conference.

24.title: Pakistan reports 1,644 new COVID-19 cases, 33 deaths
24.article_body: Pakistan reported 1,644 new COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours, said National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC) on Sunday. The authorities added the infection rate decreased to 3.29% from 4.15% in the same period. The number of patients in critical care stood at 1,386. Meanwhile, the overall death toll reached 30,009 in the country.

25.title: Hardik to be considered for selection only when 100% fit: Chetan Sharma
25.article_body: Providing an update on Hardik Pandya's return to Team India squad, BCCI chief selector Chetan Sharma said the India all-rounder will be immediately considered for selection only when he is 100% match fit. Notably, Hardik isn't a part of Indian Test and T20I squads for upcoming series against Sri Lanka. Currently, the 28-year-old is recovering from recurring back injury issues.

26.title: Countries aim to study dangers of chemical waste: UN draft resolution
26.article_body: A draft resolution of UN Environment Assembly said a proposal led by Switzerland could form a new intergovernmental panel to study dangers of chemical waste, pollution. The proposal would aim to create a strong "Science-Policy panel" similar to UN Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. Last week, a UN expert warned chemical waste has been killing more people worldwide than COVID-19.

27.title: BMC planning ₹1,600 cr link road connecting Dahisar & Bhayander
27.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning a 5-kilometre-long link road connecting Dahisar and Bhayander, construction of which will cost around ₹1,600 crore. BMC's Additional Commissioner P Velrasu said nearly 2-kilometre of it will pass through salt commissioner’s land and the process of acquiring land will start soon. The land acquisition is also expected to cost another ₹1,600 crore.

28.title: Users lose NFTs worth $1.7 million in OpenSea 'phishing attack': CEO
28.article_body: OpenSea Co-Founder and CEO Devin Finzer confirmed that 32 users lost their NFTs worth $1.7 million in a 'phishing attack'. "Importantly, rumours that this was a $200 million hack are false. The attack doesn't appear to be active at this point, we haven't seen any malicious activity from the attacker's account in 2 hours," Finzer said in a tweet.

29.title: Teacher dies, 3 students injured after falling from Ferris wheel in Haryana's Ambala
29.article_body: A 23-year-old school teacher, Riya Garg, died while three students aged between 11 and 12 were injured after falling from a Ferris wheel at an amusement park in Haryana's Ambala. Garg fell from 20 feet and died on spot when the grill of one of seating boxes of the wheel broke. Autopsy revealed Garg received head injuries and internal wounds.

30.title: T'gana CM meets Maha CM to discuss anti-BJP front, says 'good result soon'
30.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday met Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray along with other TRS leaders in Mumbai to discuss the formation of a third national political front to oppose the BJP. The meeting was attended by Shiv Sena spokesperson Sanjay Raut and actor-politician Prakash Raj. "You'll...see a good result of our meeting very soon," said KCR.

31.title: Very excited: Sanjay Kapoor on daughter's acting debut with Johar's film
31.article_body: Sanjay Kapoor has said he is extremely excited for his daughter Shanaya Kapoor's acting debut. "She has chosen this line, it's a fantastic line, we all love it, our whole family is in (it), but she would have chosen anything (else), I would've been as excited," he added. Shanaya announced her debut film with Karan Johar's Dharma Productions in 2021.

32.title: Pune civic body's polio immunisation drive to begin on February 27
32.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) polio immunisation drive is set to commence on February 27. At least 3 lakh children are expected to be vaccinated under this initiative, for which 1,350 booths have been set up. "We...have 70 transit teams of two people each to vaccinate...children who might be travelling on [that day]," PMC immunisation officer Dr Suryakant Deokar said.

33.title: India asks its nationals whose stay isn't essential & students to leave Ukraine temporarily
33.article_body: The Embassy of India in Kyiv has issued an advisory for Indian nationals in Ukraine amid threats of Russian invasion. The advisory read, "In view of the continued high levels of tensions and uncertainties with respect to the situation in Ukraine, all Indian nationals whose stay is not deemed essential and all Indian students, are advised to leave Ukraine temporarily."

34.title: Suspected LeT terrorist arrested in J&K’s Doda; arms recovered
34.article_body: A suspected terrorist belonging to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) was arrested by a joint search party of police, Rashtriya Rifles and Sashastra Seema Bal in Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district on Sunday. A pistol, two magazines and nine rounds were recovered from the man, who has been identified as Adil Iqbal Butt, a resident of Sazan-Bajarni village, said officials.

35.title: Dance teacher loses job to Covid, Delhi Police helps him find work
35.article_body: Delhi Police helped a dance teacher, Sawalkar, who had lost his job due to the COVID-19 pandemic, get job at a restaurant. Sawalkar reportedly started living in night shelter after coming from Mumbai after losing his job. "I have joined Sandoz...in food packaging department...I will get Rs 18,000 salary per month...My aim is to continue as dance teacher," he said.

36.title: Pujara smashes 91(83) in Ranji Trophy a day after being dropped from India Test squad
36.article_body: Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 91 runs off 83 deliveries in the second innings of his team Saurashtra's Ranji Trophy match against Mumbai in Ahmedabad, a day after being dropped from Team India Test squad. The 34-year-old right-handed batter, who was dismissed for a four-ball duck in the first innings, slammed 16 fours and a six in the second innings.

37.title: Saha reveals chat with Dravid over Test axe, says head coach told him to not be shocked
37.article_body: Wriddhiman Saha revealed that after India's Test series against South Africa, Rahul Dravid called him to his room and informed him team management has been "wanting to look at a new face as wicketkeeper". "[Dravid said] 'Don't be shocked if you aren't selected for Sri Lanka Tests....[Meanwhile] if you want to take some other decision...you can do that'," added Saha.

38.title: We're doing our job: Siddhant on Ranveer's permission for Gehraiyaan
38.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, speaking about comments of trolls asking if he sought Ranveer Singh's permission to do 'Gehraiyaan', said, "We are just doing our job." The film features intimate scenes of the actor with Ranveer's wife actress Deepika Padukone. "In fact, when I signed the film, [Ranveer] was the first person I called and he was really happy," Siddhant added.

39.title: Farhan, Shibani to host wedding reception later in February: Reports
39.article_body: Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar will be hosting their wedding reception in Mumbai later this month, according to reports. The couple tied the knot on February 19 in the presence of their family members and close friends at Javed Akhtar and Shabana Azmi's Khandala farmhouse. The wedding was attended by Farah Khan, Hrithik Roshan, Rhea Chakraborty, Shankar Mahadevan and others.

40.title: Bowler once gave away 77 runs in just one over
40.article_body: Wellington's Bert Vance conceded 77 runs in an over in a first-class match against Canterbury on February 20, 1990. Canterbury needed 95 to win in two overs and to encourage them to go after the target and lose wickets, Vance bowled a 22-ball over, including 17 no-balls. Interestingly, only five legitimate deliveries were bowled as umpires lost track of proceedings.

41.title: Aardvark born for the first time in 90 years in UK zoo, video released
41.article_body: A zoo in the United Kingdom has witnessed the first aardvark birth in its 90-year history and has named the animal 'Dobby' after a Harry Potter character that it resembles. A video of the female aardvark born in January 2022 was also shared by the Chester Zoo. The sex of the calf was revealed recently.

42.title: 18 Uttar Pradesh police officers booked in fake encounter case after 17 yrs
42.article_body: A case has been registered against 18 police personnel, including the then Superintendent of Police (SP), in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur in connection with an alleged fake encounter that took place 17 years ago. In October 2004, two men were allegedly shot dead by police on allegations of them being members of gangster Saragana Naresha Dhimar's gang.

43.title: Money was being given at poll booths, our duty to check: Sonu after car impounded
43.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood, who was stopped on Sunday from visiting polling booths in Punjab's Moga, claimed he received information that "threat calls" were being made at various polling booths by opposition parties, especially Shiromani Akali Dal. "Money is being distributed at some booths," he added. Sonu said that he had gone out to "check" the situation and "ensure fair elections".

44.title: 9-year-old Indian boy becomes world's youngest certified yoga instructor
44.article_body: A nine-year-old Indian boy has become the world’s youngest certified yoga instructor and created a Guinness World Record. Reyansh Surani, who resides in Dubai, said that he began practising yoga with his parents at the age of four. Reyansh completed his 200 Hour Yoga Teacher's Training Course and received certification from the Anand Shekhar Yoga School last year.

45.title: Do not create issues: Chetan Sharma to journalist over remark on Hardik Pandya
45.article_body: After a journalist remarked that Hardik Pandya will get fit before the first match of IPL and will get selected for Team India on the basis of IPL, chief selector Chetan Sharma said, "You are not a member of selection committee." Chetan added, "You won't decide who will get selected." "Do not create issues," Chetan further said.

46.title: Rahat Fateh Ali Khan tests COVID-19 +ve, cancels Dubai show
46.article_body: Pakistani singer Rahat Fateh Ali Khan's team on Saturday announced that he has tested positive for COVID-19 and cancelled his show in Dubai. The Mystical Sufi Night event has been rescheduled for March 12 as the singer will be quarantining in Dubai for the next 10 days. As per reports, the singer had tested negative for COVID-19 before leaving Pakistan.

47.title: For us he has already become Punjab CM: Bhagwant Mann's mother
47.article_body: AAP CM candidate for poll-bound Punjab, Bhagwant Mann’s mother Harpal Kaur on Sunday said that for her Mann has already become the CM. She stated, "For us, he has already become the CM. People love him." Reacting to his mother’s statement, Mann said, "If a mother has said this, what else does one want…Youth, students everyone wants a change."

48.title: Ruturaj, Sarfaraz deserve a place in Test squad vs SL: Vengsarkar
48.article_body: Ex-India captain Dilip Vengsarkar said that Ruturaj Gaikwad and Sarfaraz Khan "deserve a place" in Team India's squad for the upcoming Test series against Sri Lanka. "Looking at the team, a couple of players...haven't done much to merit their place in the squad," he stated. "Selectors are damaging [Ruturaj and Sarfaraz's] morale by not selecting them for India," he added.

49.title: Head Constable from Noida loses ₹2 lakh in online fraud
49.article_body: A Head Constable from Noida lost ₹2 lakh in online fraud. The incident took place after Devesh Kumar Upadhyay lost his debit card and was asked to download an app by a person claiming to be a bank official to block it. "As I downloaded the app, the suspect got...access to my phone and fraudulently withdrew ₹2 lakh," Upadhyay said.

50.title: Finally my community has a film: Rajkummar's sister-in-law on Badhaai Do
50.article_body: Rajkummar Rao's sister-in-law Parnalekha has penned a note praising his recently released film 'Badhaai Do'. "'Badhaai Do' is an intimate revolution that will activate a desire [for] transformation in the way 'LGBTQIA+' oriented films are made in India," she wrote, adding, "Finally, my community has a film, wherein, two girls are not sexually objectified for being two dykes in love."

51.title: PMC holds weekly demolition drives to curb illegal constructions
51.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has intensified checks on illegal constructions with weekly demolition drives in city. Illegal constructions have increased around areas of Shivane and Bavdhan, among others, officials said. "In the last month alone, several notices have been issued...We're ensuring that every week...action is taken and buildings that are found illegal are razed,” an official said.

52.title: Man held for molesting 10-yr-old kills self at Raj police station
52.article_body: A 32-year-old man, who was arrested on charges of molesting a 10-year-old girl, allegedly killed himself in a police station lock-up in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Sunday, police said. The man had three previous cases under POCSO Act registered against him in different police stations, a senior police official said. A magisterial inquiry is being done, the senior police official added.

53.title: Simplicity was the key ingredient: Hrithik's mom on Farhan-Shibani's wedding
53.article_body: Hrithik Roshan's mother Pinkie Roshan has described Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar's wedding ceremony as 'surreal'. She shared a picture of herself in the outfit she wore at their wedding and wrote, "It was too special, total bliss to have witnessed a marriage ceremony that was surreal, simplicity was the key ingredient." "God bless Farhan and Shibani," Pinkie added.

54.title: What's 'Goli maaro' if not incitement to kill: Ex-SC judge on hate speech
54.article_body: Former Supreme Court judge Justice Madan Lokur, on Sunday, while delivering an address on hate speech in India said, "We have had, in Delhi, a minister...saying 'Goli Maaro'. What is that if not incitement to kill. But he might say 'I never said it, I just said you shoot. I didn't say whom to shoot...the listeners said traitors'."

55.title: ₹295 cr mansion in UK to be sold in real life & metaverse in world's 1st such sale
55.article_body: A £29 million (around ₹295 crore) mansion in the UK will be developed and sold both in reality and in the metaverse in the world's first such deal, according to property developer Stately Homes. The mansion will be sold with an NFT containing the copyrighted blueprint and virtual version. The mansion will have 70 rooms in total, including 11 bedrooms.

56.title: Russia reports over 1.7 lakh new COVID-19 cases, 745 deaths
56.article_body: Russia reported 1,70,699 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the authorities said on Sunday. The country also recorded 745 deaths in the same period taking the total fatality count to 3,45,500 since the pandemic began. Saint Petersburg saw 16,599 new cases, the highest in the country, while in Moscow, 6,388 cases were registered.

57.title: 13 years passed, all this is still so fresh in my mind: Abhishek on 'Delhi 6'
57.article_body: As the movie 'Delhi 6' clocked 13 years on Sunday, actor Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram to share a post. "From Mamdu's Jalebi, to Dadi's laad-pyaar to Bittu's chirping and Ali Chacha's words of wisdom...13 years passed, but all this is still so fresh in my mind. #13yearsofDelhi6," Abhishek wrote. 'Delhi 6' also featured actresses Sonam Kapoor and Waheeda Rehman.

58.title: I am MP from UP but previous govt didn’t let me work: PM Modi
58.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said that despite being a member of parliament from Uttar Pradesh, he wasn't allowed to work for people in the state by the previous government. "I am sad that from 2014 to 2017 these 'parivarvadis' did not support me," said Modi addressing a rally in Hardoi. "Should such people be re-elected?" he asked.

59.title: Samson is in our scheme of things for T20 WC: BCCI chief selector Chetan
59.article_body: BCCI chief selector Chetan Sharma said wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson, who has represented India in 10 T20Is so far, is definitely in the board's scheme of things for T20 World Cup 2022. The 27-year-old has been included in India's 18-member squad for upcoming three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. Samson last played in a T20I against Sri Lanka in July 2021.

60.title: Kamathipura residents protest against 'Gangubai...' over 'shameful' portrayal of area
60.article_body: The residents of Kamathipura staged a protest and raised slogans against upcoming film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' for allegedly showcasing the area in a bad light. The locals alleged that the way the area has been portrayed in film is "wrong" and shameful". The film is based on Gangubai Kothewali, who was considered to be the matriarch of Mumbai's Kamathipura in 1960s.

61.title: I don't use social media: Nilekani as he lists 3 devices he uses for work
61.article_body: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani in an interview revealed that he doesn't use social media. Speaking about the three modes he works with, he said, "In the create mode to work...I use a laptop...For the curate mode...or just browse, I use an iPad; and for...communication I use...phone." He added that he uses Twitter to broadcast information and not for discussions.

62.title: Wordle is now using ad-trackers: Report
62.article_body: New York Time's Wordle is now using ad-trackers, according to a report by Gizmodo. The report states that some of the trackers are from NYT, but others are being used to send data to third parties, including Google. "NYT didn't change the game, but they sure changed the deployment. Lots more tracking," said Ben Adida, Executive Director of VotingWorks.

63.title: Russia's treatment of Ukraine similar to Soviet threats: Finland Prez
63.article_body: Finland President Sauli Niinistö said on Saturday that Russia's treatment of Ukraine reminded him of Soviet leader Josef Stalin's attempt to invade Finland in 1939 during World War II. "Stalin thought...he will split [Finland]...The opposite happened. People [were] united...we see the same in Ukraine," he said. His comments come amid build-up of some 1.9 lakh Russian troops on Ukrainian border.

64.title: Half of India's population under 25, suitable for Olympic Movement: Nita Ambani
64.article_body: Businesswoman and International Olympic Committee (IOC) member Nita Ambani said, "Nearly half of India's population, over 600 million people, are under 25 years of age." She added, "This makes India one of the most crucial and exciting places to nurture and grow the Olympic Movement." India will host the IOC Session in 2023 after 40 years.

65.title: Completely false: Tom Holland on buying house in London with Zendaya
65.article_body: Actor Tom Holland has said that the reports of him buying a house in London with girlfriend Zendaya are completely false. "I've had so many people call me...I didn't buy a house!" Tom added. He further said that he doesn't know how the rumours started, adding, "I was like, 'Wow! What a surprise! I wonder when I'll get the keys'."

66.title: Lineman electrocuted in Ghaziabad, ₹11 lakh ex-gratia announced
66.article_body: A lineman in Ghaziabad was killed after being electrocuted while repairing a fault in an 11,000-kilowatt power cable. The victim's family members had blocked traffic on Eastern Peripheral Expressway, demanding strict action against those responsible for switching on the line. The blockade was lifted after police assured strict action and an ex-gratia of ₹11 lakh was announced for victim's family.

67.title: 2 labourers killed, 2 grievously injured as steam boiler explodes in TN
67.article_body: Two labourers from Jharkhand were killed after a steam boiler at a prawn farm in Tamil Nadu's Mayiladuthurai district exploded on Sunday, police said. Two other workers from Thirumullaivasal village, who sustained grievous injuries in the incident, have been admitted to a government hospital in Sirkazhi. Exact details about the incident will be known only after preliminary inquiry, police added.

68.title: Man held for posing as Colonel, cheating with Army job offers in Ahmednagar
68.article_body: In a joint operation with the MI unit of the Pune headquartered Southern Command, the Ahmednagar district police arrested a 24-year-old man posing as a Colonel in the Indian Army. The man allegedly cheated several people on the pretext of giving them jobs in the Army. An Army uniform, multiple fake Army insignia and several fake documents were seized.

69.title: I fell down iron stairs, all I could think of was Bob Saget: Dana Delany
69.article_body: American actress Dana Delany said that she recently fell down some iron stairs. "I fell down some iron stairs headfirst (totally sober!)...all I could think of was poor Bob Saget," she said. "So I grabbed the handrail with my face...I was afraid it was fractured but thankfully, no. Folks at St John's emergency took great care of me," Dana added.

70.title: Gehraiyaan role hard for family, they've seen it up close: Deepika
70.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has stated that it was difficult for her family to digest what her character in 'Gehraiyaan' goes through. "They've seen it so up close and personal with me that I think at a personal level it was difficult for them to go through that," she added. Deepika further said they appreciated the way mental health was depicted.

71.title: ICJ to resume hearing on Rohingya genocide in Myanmar
71.article_body: The International Court of Justice will resume hearing the case of Rohingya genocide in Myanmar on Monday. African country Gambia, which claims to represent an organisation of Muslim nations, has accused Myanmar of breach of the genocide convention. As many as seven lakh Rohingya Muslims reportedly fled the country after a military crackdown against them in 2017.

72.title: WB minister Sadhan Pande passes away aged 71; CM Mamata expresses grief
72.article_body: West Bengal Cabinet Minister and senior TMC leader Sadhan Pande passed away on Sunday morning in Mumbai at the age of 71. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee offered condolences on the demise of the TMC leader. "Had a wonderful relation for long. Deeply pained at this loss. My heartfelt condolences to his family, friends, followers," the CM said in a tweet.

73.title: Brie Larson wraps up 'Captain Marvel 2', shares pic from sets
73.article_body: American actress Brie Larson has completed shooting for 'The Marvels', the sequel to the 2019 film 'Captain Marvel'. She took to social media to share a picture of a chair which has her character's name written on it. "See you in a year, Carol," Brie captioned the picture. The film is slated to release on February 17, 2023.

74.title: Tripura govt bans political events, rallies on school grounds
74.article_body: Tripura government on Saturday issued an order banning political parties from using school resources, including playgrounds, for holding political events or rallies. The order mentioned that some headmasters had given permission for political gatherings during school hours and called it "unacceptable". It said that such gatherings pose a "serious threat to teaching-learning activities".

75.title: No surprise there: Gavaskar on Rohit being named India Test captain
75.article_body: After Rohit Sharma was appointed as India Test captain, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said he wasn't surprised by the decision as Rohit is certain to play in all three formats. The 34-year-old opener was appointed as Test captain ahead of the T20I and Test series against Sri Lanka at home. Notably, Rohit is India's all-format captain now.

76.title: US’ California proposes bill to allow citizens to sue gun-makers
76.article_body: The Governor of the US' California, Gavin Newsom, has proposed a bill that seeks to allow private citizens to sue the gun manufacturers for selling assault weapons. Notably, manufacturing and selling assault weapons was banned in the state for decades but that law was overturned last year by a district judge, who declared it unconstitutional.

77.title: I was fired from projects after announcing first pregnancy: Neha Dhupia
77.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said that she was fired from projects after announcing her first pregnancy. "During Mehr's time, I had to create work...I was being myself because being pregnant wasn't a problem...But the industry changes. Before I announced my pregnancy, I was a part of a few projects. Did I get fired from those projects? Yes, I did," Dhupia said.

78.title: Donald Glover, 'Atlanta' writers racially harassed in London: Writers
78.article_body: The writers of comedy-drama series 'Atlanta' have revealed they along with actor Donald Glover were racially harassed in London. They added that a group of people said, "You guys are black, you've gone to jail and do things like that." They claimed we could break into a bar because we carry hammers, which is slang for guns, the writers said.

79.title: LaBeouf got mad, Brad got in middle of 'volatile moment': Scott on 'Fury'
79.article_body: Actor Scott Eastwood said that he had "volatile encounter" with actor Shia LaBeouf during film 'Fury' and that Brad Pitt had to intervene to resolve situation. "[LaBeouf] got mad at me...it turned into a volatile moment...Brad Pitt ultimately got in the middle of." LaBeouf had reportedly confronted Eastwood over a miscommunication about filming.

80.title: Voting underway at pink polling booth managed by women in Punjab's Moga
80.article_body: Voting is underway for Assembly polls at pink booth in Moga, Punjab, which provides special arrangements for pregnant women and persons with disabilities, among other people. These booths were set up by the Election Commission across the state to encourage women voters to vote. Pink booths are managed entirely by women polling personnel.

81.title: Ethiopia starts generating electricity from dam on Nile river
81.article_body: Ethiopian government officials said on Sunday that a hydroelectric dam built on a tributary of the Nile river has started generating electricity. The Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam is expected to produce over 5,000 megawatts of power and will be the largest hydroelectric project in Africa. "From now on, there will be nothing that will stop Ethiopia," PM Abiy Ahmed said.

82.title: Kangana says '₹200 cr will be burnt to ashes' ahead of 'Gangubai...' release
82.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has seemingly taken a dig at Alia Bhatt's upcoming film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', which is scheduled to release in theatres on February 25. She took to her Instagram Stories and said "₹200 crore will be burnt to ashes" this Friday "for a papa (movie mafia daddy) ki pari because papa wants to prove that romcom bimbo can act".

83.title: China plans to turn Olympic ski jump into a very large water slide
83.article_body: China plans to turn the Shougang Big Air ski jump structure, built on the site of a decommissioned steel mill for the Winter Olympics, into a very large water slide during the summers. Alternatively, it could be used for grass sledding after covering it with turf. Some of the venues from the 2008 Summer Game were earlier re-purposed by Beijing.

84.title: Body of man accused in POCSO case and absconding for 3 yrs found in Maha well
84.article_body: A person's body, which was found in a well in Maharashtra, has been identified as a man, who was an accused in a POCSO case and was absconding from Kerala for last three years. Investigations revealed he was murdered by two Kashid-based persons over a fight and his body was tied to a cement pole and immersed in the well.

85.title: He didn't tell me he was married, had daughters when we met: Aruna on husband
85.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani said she did not know her husband Kuku Kohli was already married and had kids when she first met him. "He didn't tell me he was married...it didn't look good to speak about our relationship as he was married...with a wife and daughters...I am talking about it because his first wife passed away...few months back," she said.

86.title: Pune passenger trains ticket fare increased by about 50%: Report
86.article_body: An official has said that Pune Railway Division has increased passenger trains ticket fare as per an order from higher authorities, which mentioned that the fare should be the same as express trains, Hindustan Times reported. The passenger trains ticket fare has been increased by about 50%, report said. A passenger claimed that the facilities provided are the same.

87.title: Sonu Sood stopped from visiting polling booths in Punjab; his car impounded
87.article_body: The Election Commission on Sunday stopped actor Sonu Sood from visiting the polling booths in Punjab's Moga, from where his sister Malvika Sood Sachar is contesting in the Assembly elections on a Congress ticket. Sonu has been allegedly accused of trying to influence the voters. Earlier, Sonu's SUV was impounded on the basis of "suspicious activity", according to police.

88.title: Video shows helicopter crashing into ocean at crowded Miami beach; 2 injured
88.article_body: A helicopter crashed into the ocean at Miami’s South Beach on Saturday afternoon, leaving two injured. A video of the incident shared by the Miami Beach Police captured the moment when the helicopter crashed near an area that was full of swimmers. The US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has launched an investigation into the incident.

89.title: Russia planning biggest war in Europe since 1945: UK PM Boris Johnson amid Ukraine crisis
89.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has said Russia is planning for something that could be the biggest war in Europe since 1945. He said, "You're looking at not just an invasion through the east...but according to the intelligence we're seeing, coming down from the north...and actually encircling Kyiv itself, as Joe Biden explained to a lot of us last night."

90.title: Not a Tinder swindler, wanted to meet girls: Hayut in 1st interview after Netflix show
90.article_body: Shimon Hayut, who went by the alias Simon Leviev has given his first interview after the Netflix documentary 'The Tinder Swindler' streamed. In a clip from the interview, Hayut said, "I was just a single guy who wanted to meet some girls on Tinder...I'm not a Tinder swindler."  The documentary covers stories of women who were allegedly defrauded by Hayut.

91.title: FIR against Sameer Wankhede for misrepresenting age to get bar licence
91.article_body: An FIR has been registered against former Mumbai NCB zonal director Sameer Wankhede for allegedly obtaining a bar licence by willful misrepresentation of his age, police said. The FIR was filed on Saturday night based on the complaint of State Excise department's Shankar Gogavale, who alleged that Wankhede was below 18 years of age in 1996-97 while obtaining the licence.

92.title: AAP's Raghav Chadha claims EVM glitches at several booths in Punjab
92.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Sunday alleged EVM glitches at several booths across Punjab. He accused SAD and Congress of booth capturing. "In Bhoa AC's Booth No 95, a polling agent of Congress has placed his chair next to EVM so that he has a clear view of who is voting for which party," Chadha tweeted.

93.title: Vikrant Massey, Sheetal Thakur share pics from their haldi ceremony
93.article_body: Actors Vikrant Massey and Sheetal Thakur took to their respective Instagram accounts to share pictures from their haldi ceremony. Reacting to Massey's post, actress Neha Laxmi wrote, "Congratulations @vikrantmassey you two look like such a happy couple!!" Vikrant and Sheetal got married on Friday after seven years of dating.

94.title: My mom called Marvel producers, said 'give my son toilet breaks': Tom Holland
94.article_body: Actor Tom Holland said his mom called Marvel producers to ask them to give him "toilet breaks". Tom said, "I was in suit for...11 hours...I was young...wanted to impress studio...didn't want them to think I needed breaks...two days later producer came...was like, 'How are your kidneys?'...My mom called...biggest studio in world and was like, 'Give my son more toilet breaks!'"

95.title: Bengaluru police bust illegal dance bar in Koramangala; 3 arrested
95.article_body: Three people were arrested after Bengaluru police busted an illegal dance bar in Koramangala, where purportedly 28 women from multiple states had been brought to perform. A senior police officer said that the women were allegedly brought there under the pretext of bartender jobs and were forced to perform. Lakhs of rupees were reportedly seized from 21 customers present there.

96.title: 24-yr-old Hyd woman set on fire by labourer for resisting advances
96.article_body: A 24-year-old Hyderabad-based woman died on Saturday after reportedly being set on fire by a labourer for resisting his advances. Reports said that the man set her ablaze at an isolated place in Telangana's Narayanpet. The victim's father had reportedly complained to police about her being missing a few days ago. Police said that the victim's family suspected the labourer.

97.title: Even Rahul Dravid suggested I think about retirement: Wriddhiman Saha after Test axe
97.article_body: After being dropped from India Test squad, Wriddhiman Saha revealed that the team management had earlier told him that he would not be considered henceforth. He added, "I could not tell this so long as I was part of the India team setup...Even head coach Rahul Dravid suggested that I think about taking retirement."

98.title: Ranbir, Arjun Kapoor reach Agra to attend filmmaker Luv Ranjan's wedding
98.article_body: Several celebrities, including Ranbir Kapoor, Arjun Kapoor, Shraddha Kapoor and Bhushan Kumar, have reached Agra to attend filmmaker Luv Ranjan's wedding, as per reports. Actor Varun Sharma was also seen arriving in Agra. The filmmaker, known for films like 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama' and 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety', will reportedly tie the knot with long-time girlfriend Alisha Vaid today.

99.title: He's different from characters he plays on screen: Ananya on Deverakonda
99.article_body: Ananya Panday, speaking about her 'Liger' co-star Vijay Deverakonda, said that he is different from the characters he plays on screen. She added that he's "very shy, quiet, very sweet and enduring" and an amazing co-star. Speaking about 'Liger', Ananya said that it's a "super popcorn entertaining masala" film, adding, "I couldn't have asked for anything bigger."

100.title: SAD-BSP to make clean sweep in Punjab, we'll get 80+ seats: Sukhbir Badal
100.article_body: As the Assembly polls in Punjab are underway, Sukhbir Singh Badal, Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief said that the Shiromani Akali Dal-BSP alliance is going to make a "clean sweep". "We will get 80 plus seats," Badal added. Badal along with SAD leader Harsimrat Kaur Badal and SAD patron Parkash Singh Badal arrived at the polling station in Lambi today.

101.title: Epstein-linked model agent found dead in French jail: Prosecutors
101.article_body: Late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's close associate and model agent Jean-Luc Brunel was found dead in his cell at a prison in France's Paris, prosecutors said on Saturday. Brunel was awaiting his trial on charges of raping a minor and sexual harassment. Epstein allegedly died by suicide at a prison in US' New York in 2019.

102.title: Grenade attack injures 3 policemen in Pakistan’s Peshawar
102.article_body: At least three policemen were injured in a grenade attack in Pakistan's Peshawar. The incident, which was reportedly captured on CCTV cameras, showed a man lobbing two grenades at a police station in the city. The attacker managed to escape after the act, according to media reports. The injured policemen were taken to Lady Reading Hospital for treatment.

103.title: Maid urged to sell her kidney, cheated of ₹8 lakh; Delhi man held
103.article_body: Delhi man, Arvind Kumar, was arrested after his friend Rabina Badi, from Nepal, allegedly cheated maid Kalpana Magar of ₹8 lakh. Badi told Magar she had relocated to Delhi after selling kidney for ₹4 crore and that it was possible to lead normal life with one kidney. Badi added Magar would have to pay "few lakhs" before kidney was harvested.

104.title: Russia planning full-scale attack on Ukraine: NATO chief
104.article_body: Denying claims of military pull-out by Russia, NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg has said that the country is planning a full-scale attack on Ukraine. "No troops are being withdrawn as Russia says, but new troops are being added," he said, adding that Russia was preparing a pretext for the attack. "We want to get Russia to change course," he further said.

105.title: US' FDA issues warning after 1,100 dead rodents found at retailer facility
105.article_body: US' Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has issued a warning over the potentially contaminated food at variety store chain Family Dollar in six states after 1,100 dead rodents were found at the retailer's distribution facility in Arkansas. The warning was issued for Alabama, Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi, Missouri and Tennessee. FDA had investigated the facility in January following a complaint.

106.title: Just chamchagiri: Virender Sehwag on journalist's threatening WhatsApp texts to Saha
106.article_body: After Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of WhatsApp messages sent to him by a journalist forcing him to give an interview after being dropped from Team India, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "Extremely sad." He added, "Such sense of entitlement, neither is he respected nor a journalist...just chamchagiri." "This is where the journalism has gone," Saha had tweeted while sharing the screenshot.

107.title: Delhi Police officer's daughter strangled to death by her friend's husband
107.article_body: A Delhi Police officer's daughter in her 20s was allegedly strangled to death by her friend's husband. Investigators said her body was found at the home of the suspect, who is absconding. The victim's mother claimed he called the woman to his house as he needed her help to buy a saree for his wife as a Valentine's Day gift.

108.title: Newly-wed bride cast vote in UP before leaving for her in-laws’ house
108.article_body: A newly-wed bride, Julie, cast her vote at a polling booth in UP’s Firozabad Assembly constituency on Sunday, before leaving for her in-laws’ house. Julie, who got married last night, arrived at the location in her wedding dress today. Voting for the third phase of UP Assembly polls, in 59 seats, began at 7 am today.

109.title: SRK told me 'you're very good, things will happen': Actor Satyajeet Dubey
109.article_body: Actor Satyajeet Dubey said actor Shah Rukh Khan told him to keep trying and things will happen for him. "My first film was produced by Shah Rukh..it didn't work...I was like a baby...kept wondering where I stood...I met SRK after 2-3 years. He told me, 'You are very good. Just keep trying like you've been doing...things will happen'." Dubey said.

110.title: If people think Sonu is star, it's icing on cake for me: Malvika on polls
110.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood's sister Malvika Sood, who is contesting from Punjab's Moga seat on Congress ticket, said that she feels positive about the poll day. "People are calling up...from foreign countries...are cheering for my support...Many of them have assured to vote for me...If people think Sonu Sood is a star, it's an icing on the cake for me," she said.

111.title: Hugh Grant joins cast of 'Wonka', to play Oompa Loompa in the film: Reports
111.article_body: Actor Hugh Grant has reportedly signed on to play an Oompa Loompa in the upcoming 'Charlie And The Chocolate Factory' prequel film, 'Wonka'. According to reports, he has also started shooting for the project at the University of Oxford's Hertford College. The upcoming film will feature Timothée Chalamet as young Willy Wonka. 'Wonka' also stars Olivia Colman and Sally Hawkins.

112.title: Actress Lindsey Pearlman found dead days after going missing in Los Angeles
112.article_body: Actress Lindsey Pearlman, who starred in shows like 'General Hospital' and 'American Housewife', was found dead on Friday, days after going missing in Los Angeles. Investigators had sought the public's help in finding the 43-year-old actress who was last seen around noon last Sunday. The cause of death and the circumstances of her disappearance are under investigation.

113.title: Wife making frequent discreet calls to another man at odd hours is cruelty: Kerala HC
113.article_body: While granting a decree of divorce to a couple, Kerala High Court ruled, "Making discreet phone calls frequently by the wife with another man disregarding the warning of the husband, that too at odd hours, amounts to matrimonial cruelty." The court, however, noted that the evidence of phone calls is not enough to infer adultery on part of the wife.

114.title: BJP’s slip issued upon voting for SP, discrepancies in VVPAT: SP
114.article_body: As the third phase of UP Assembly polls began on Sunday, the Samajwadi Party (SP) alleged discrepancies in the Electronic Voting Machine (EVM). The party alleged that the VVPAT issued a slip of the BJP on pressing the button for the SP at a polling booth in Kanpur rural. The party further stated about the "defective" VVPAT in Hamirpur District.

115.title: Over 1,500 ceasefire violations reported in Ukraine: Europe agency
115.article_body: Over 1,500 ceasefire violations were reported in east Ukraine on Saturday, believed to be the highest this year, according to the world's largest regional security body Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE). Of the total ceasefire violations, 1,413 were explosions, the OSCE said. Earlier, US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said that Russia is "poised to strike" Ukraine.

116.title: FIR lodged against Kanpur Mayor for sharing photo of voting on WhatsApp
116.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against Kanpur Mayor Pramila Pandey for the breach of secrecy of voting at the Hudson school polling station, according to Kanpur Nagar DM. Pandey had allegedly shared on WhatsApp a photo of the Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) as she cast her vote during the third phase of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls.

117.title: We lost 1 generation to terrorism, 2nd to drugs; vote carefully: Sidhu
117.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu said people will vote in large numbers to bring the change. "On one side is the mafia system of Badal family and Captain Amarinder Singh. On the other side are those who love Punjab," Sidhu added. "We lost one generation to terrorism, the second to drugs, so, today we've to vote carefully," Sidhu stated.

118.title: China aiming laser at our aircraft an act of intimidation: Australian PM
118.article_body: Days after a Chinese navy vessel reportedly aimed a laser at an Australian military surveillance aircraft, Prime Minister Scott Morrison criticised it calling it "an act of intimidation". "I can see it no other way than an act of intimidation…unprovoked, unwarranted," said Morrison. "Australia will never accept such acts of intimidation," he added.

119.title: 2 injured as helicopter crashes near crowded US beach; video surfaces
119.article_body: A helicopter with three onboard crashed near a crowded beach in the US' Florida. Two people were hospitalised after getting injured in the incident. Sharing footage of the incident on Twitter, Miami Beach Police said, "Two occupants have been transported to Jackson Memorial Hospital in stable condition." The beach area has been closed, it added.

120.title: 2 Benin bronzes returned to Nigeria after over 100 years
120.article_body: Two Benin bronzes were returned to Oba Palace in Nigeria's Benin City on Saturday after they were taken by British troops over 100 years ago. The artefacts were created from at least 16th century onwards, according to the British Museum. "They are not just art but they are things that underline the significance of our spirituality," a palace spokesperson said.

121.title: Celebrities like Vicky, Sara come to me for preparation: Martial arts trainer
121.article_body: Martial artist Harshh Verma said that many celebrities like Vicky Kaushal, Sara Ali Khan and Kriti Sanon come to his school for the preparations of their films. "Sara and Vicky trained like warriors, and their characters had demand of their persona...They trained in weapons flexibility reflexes of action-reaction...mainly becoming one with their weapon...making it part of their body," he said.

122.title: 8 people on way to attend wedding killed as car falls into river in Rajasthan's Kota
122.article_body: Eight people died after the car they were travelling in lost control and fell off a small culvert and into the Chambal river in Rajasthan's Kota, as per reports. The incident took place when the occupants of the car were on their way to attend a wedding. The car was reportedly retrieved from water with the help of a crane.

123.title: Natural Diamond Council’s new campaign says 'Thank You'
123.article_body: According to Natural Diamond Council, the purchase of a natural diamond supports the livelihoods of over 2 million Indians, provides insurance covers to more than 650,000 people and sustains communities. With this new initiative, NDC and GJEPC aim to express gratitude to everyone who bought a natural diamond by highlighting the positive socio-economic and environmental impact of the industry.

124.title: We're having a problem with China: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar in Germany
124.article_body: Addressing a security conference in Germany, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "We're having a problem with China." He said, "The problem is that for 45 years there was peace...That changed because we had agreements not to bring military forces to LAC but China violated those agreements." The minister added, "Relations with China are going through a very difficult phase."

125.title: Don't want to discuss personal life: Ammy Virk on reports that he's married & has a child
125.article_body: Reacting to reports that he is married and has a two-year-old daughter, singer-actor Ammy Virk said, "It is my personal life and I don't want to discuss it with anyone." He added, "Whenever we will disclose it, we will reveal everything. Whether I’m married or I’ve a kid or how many I have, I will talk about everything."

126.title: Singer Afsana Khan gets married to singer Saajz, shares pics
126.article_body: Singer Afsana Khan, who participated in 'Bigg Boss 15' last year, tied the knot with singer Saajz on Saturday. Several other Bigg Boss participants like Rakhi Sawant, Umar Riaz, Himanshi Khurana, Rashami Desai and Yuvika Chaudhary attended her wedding. Sharing pictures on Instagram, Afsana wrote, "Our happily ever after begins now."

127.title: PM Modi greets people of Arunachal Pradesh, Mizoram on Statehood Day
127.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday greeted Arunachal Pradesh and Mizoram's people on their Statehood Day. "People of Arunachal Pradesh are known for their stupendous talent and hardworking nature. May the state scale new heights of development in times to come," he tweeted. "India takes great pride in the vibrant Mizo culture and contributions of Mizoram to national progress," he added.

128.title: We wish we could've known him: Priyanka's father-in-law on her late father
128.article_body: Priyanka Chopra's mother Madhu Chopra on Saturday shared a post on Instagram, remembering her late husband Ashok Chopra on their wedding anniversary. Sharing an old picture, she wrote, "A beautiful journey. Blessed." Priyanka's father-in-law Paul Kevin Jonas Sr reacted to her post, writing, "Happy anniversary! We wish we could've known him. Thankful for you and Priyanka in our lives."

129.title: I want to be with someone who allows me to change: Ananya
129.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday said in an interview that she wants to be in a relationship that allows her to be herself. "I want to be with someone who allows me to change and keep growing and discovering who I am as a person," she added. "I've changed a lot since I had started...and I want to continue changing," said Ananya.

130.title: Pune builder looking for firearm licence cheated of ₹10 lakh
130.article_body: A Pune-based builder was allegedly cheated of ₹10 lakh by a person who promised to get him a firearm licence. The accused said he had connections in the ministry and collected ₹5 lakh from the victim on two occasions. However, "the complainant's application with Pune police for firearm licence was rejected in 2018," said police. The accused is absconding.

131.title: 8 luxury buses damaged in fire at Gujarat travel company's workshop
131.article_body: Eight luxury buses of Patel Tours and Travels were damaged after a fire broke out at the company's workshop in Gujarat. Fire officials said no casualties were reported. Prima facie, it appears that a bus, which was being painted, caught fire when a welding and cutting process was being carried out on an adjoining bus at the workshop, officials added.

132.title: Pune police arrest man for giving TET candidate list to agents
132.article_body: Pune police have arrested a 33-year-old man for allegedly providing a list of candidates of Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) 2018 to agents who took money for changing final scores. "The list was provided in October 2018 and a payment of ₹80 lakh was made in December 2018," a source close to the investigation was quoted as saying.

133.title: 58 K'taka college students suspended for wearing hijab, protests
133.article_body: At least 58 students from a college in Karnataka's Shivamogga were suspended on Saturday for wearing a hijab and holding a protest demanding that they should be allowed to attend classes. The principal said that they couldn't allow the hijab-wearing students to enter according to the state High Court's interim order. The crowd was dispersed after police intervened.

134.title: Mulayam forced to campaign for son Akhilesh: BJP's Karhal candidate
134.article_body: BJP's Karhal candidate SP Singh Baghel said the SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav was "forcefully" brought to the town this week to campaign for son Akhilesh Yadav. "Mulayam Singh Yadav didn't come to Karhal willingly," Baghel added. "If he was the guardian of SP, then he would've also campaigned for other weaker candidates but he isn't doing that," Baghel stated.

135.title: Channi visits Shiv temple on poll day, says 'I prayed for Punjab'
135.article_body: As voting process started in Punjab on Sunday, state Chief Minister Charanjit Channi visited Shiv temple in Kharar. "Good government should come in Punjab, transparent government should come, there should be chance to run next government with noble policy. I am always seeker for the welfare of all so I prayed for the well being of entire Punjab," Channi said.

136.title: 3 of family burnt alive for resisting house demolition in Bihar, 9 held
136.article_body: Nine people were arrested after three members of family were burnt alive for allegedly protesting against demolition of their house in Bihar's Darbhanga. "Three members of  family were burnt alive for protesting the demolition of their house. Two people, including main accused, were arrested in Darbhanga last night. A total of nine accused have been arrested so far," police said.

137.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases fall below 20,000-mark; 673 deaths reported in 24 hours
137.article_body: India has reported 19,968 new COVID-19 cases and 673 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 673 deaths, 261 deaths were reported during the day in the country, while as many as 412 are reconciled deaths reported in Kerala. India's active caseload stood at 2,24,187.

138.title: James Faulkner banned for life from PSL after PCB deny non-payment allegations
138.article_body: Australian cricketer James Faulkner has been banned for life from Pakistan Super League (PSL), with Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) refuting allegations of non-payment made against them. The PCB said payment due to Faulkner as per his contract are fully up to date. The board further said Faulkner damaged hotel property and even acted inappropriately with the immigration authorities at airport.

139.title: Bengal student leader dies after being thrown off terrace of 3-storey building
139.article_body: A 28-year-old student leader at West Bengal's Aliah University died after four unidentified persons allegedly pushed him off the terrace of his residence at a three-storey building in Howrah, police said. The victim's father claimed one of the accused was in police uniform and had a gun. Around 500 protesters took out a candle march from the university to Entally.

140.title: 4 with links to Khalistani terrorist groups arrested in Haryana
140.article_body: Haryana Police have arrested at least four people who allegedly are associated with Khalistani terrorist groups in Sonipat on Friday. The police also recovered six weapons, including an AK-47, and 56 live cartridges from their possession. The accused also reportedly admitted to killing a person on the Khalistani terrorist groups' instructions and had received lakhs of rupees from them.

141.title: Ganguly had texted me 'As long as I'm here, you'd be in team': Saha after getting dropped
141.article_body: After being dropped from Test team, wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha revealed after he scored 61* against New Zealand in Kanpur in November 2021, Sourav Ganguly texted him on WhatsApp saying, "As long as I'm here...you'd be in the team." Saha added, "Such a message from BCCI President really boosted my confidence...What I’m struggling to understand is...how things have changed so fast."

142.title: Indian Army uses drones to supply booster doses to forward troops in J&K
142.article_body: Indian Army reportedly used drones to supply booster doses of COVID-19 vaccine to forward troops in areas of Jammu and Kashmir under mission Sanjeevani. Reports suggest a package, that was well padded for protection, was dropped for forward troops in snow-clad areas. Over 1.89 crores precaution doses for the identified categories of beneficiaries for vaccination have been administered in India.

143.title: SP has links with 2008 Ahmedabad serial blast incident: Anurag Thakur
143.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Saturday alleged that the Samajwadi Party (SP) has links with the 2008 Ahmedabad serial bomb blast case. Thakur has asked the SP chief to respond to his allegations. "When it comes to terrorism, BJP has a zero-tolerance policy while the Samajwadi Party gives full protection to terrorists," Thakur added.

144.title: Conjoined twins vote in Punjab elections, given goggles to maintain secrecy of voting
144.article_body: Conjoined twins, Sohna Singh and Mohna Singh, on Sunday cast their votes for the first time in Punjab Assembly elections as separate voters. Inmates of an orphanage in Amritsar, the two were abandoned by their biological parents in a Delhi hospital after their birth. An official said that goggles were arranged for the twins to maintain the secrecy of voting.

145.title: Woman gets injured resisting snatching in Delhi, dies in hospital
145.article_body: A 40-year-old woman who went comatose after suffering a brain haemorrhage while resisting a snatching bid in Delhi died in hospital 12 days after the incident. The victim fell off an e-rickshaw on her way to attend a wedding when two bike-borne men snatched her bag. The perpetrators were arrested and will be charged with murder, said police.

146.title: Man arrested for threatening ex-boss by posing as gangster in Gurugram
146.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly making extortion calls to his former employer, a businessman based in Gurugram, by posing as a member of the notorious Neeraj Bawana gang. The businessman said he got calls threatening to shoot him outside his Rohtak factory. According to police, the accused was recently fired from the job for his involvement in criminal activities.

147.title: Assam govt to hand over few drug cases to NCB: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
147.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said that the state government is handing over a few drug cases to the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB). "The step has been taken to establish forward and backward linkages that are not in our jurisdiction," Sarma added. "We hope that Assam becomes a role model after five years," Sarma stated.

148.title: BJP will strive for UP to be among safest, most educated states: Amit Shah
148.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that the BJP aims to take Uttar Pradesh to the top of the list of safest, most educated and prosperous states. "After 2014, (PM) Modiji made many efforts to take Uttar Pradesh forward but the SP government was a major obstacle in those efforts," Shah added.

149.title: 2 policemen arrested, another wanted in robbery and extortion case in Mumbai
149.article_body: Two police officers have been arrested while another police inspector is wanted for allegedly robbing a few Angadia service providers and extorting money from them in Mumbai's Bhuleshwar. The policemen had allegedly illegally detained them and threatened to inform the Income Tax Department about their business transactions. The arrested officers were remanded to police custody till February 21.

150.title: Akshay to star in remake of Suriya's 'Soorarai Pottru', confirms Paresh Rawal
150.article_body: Akshay Kumar has been roped in to play the lead role in the Hindi remake of 'Soorarai Pottru', confirmed Paresh Rawal, who starred in the original film. The 66-year-old actor added that he'll also star in the remake. "My role is...same, I being in opposition, is one who tries to sabotage his airlines," Paresh added. 'Soorarai Pottru' also featured Suriya.

151.title: Don't like PDA, may not be able to hold hand in public: Siddhant on girlfriend
151.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi has reportedly revealed that he is not single in real life but he wants to keep his relationship under wraps. "I like simple things. I'm very shy, I don't like PDA and may not be able to hold (her) hand in public," he said, adding, "Showing it in front of world is not my piece of cake."

152.title: Hyderabad SHE Teams conduct women-centric awareness programme in metro
152.article_body: The SHE Teams in Hyderabad conducted awareness programmes in metro trains. The Hyderabad police took to social media to share pictures of volunteers holding up posters in the metro, amongst commuters. The posters can be seen saying, "Stop violence against women." One of the posters also said, "The power of change is in our hands."

153.title: Wriddhiman Saha shares screenshot of WhatsApp messages from journalist threatening him
153.article_body: Wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha took to Twitter to share screenshot of WhatsApp messages he received from a journalist after being dropped from India Test team. In the chat, the journalist threatens Saha that he'd never interview him as the wicketkeeper didn't call him. "After all of my contributions to Indian cricket..this is what I face...from a so-called 'Respected' journalist!" Saha wrote.

154.title: Daily COVID-19 cases fall to 646 in Bengaluru, 8 deaths reported
154.article_body: The number of daily coronavirus cases in Bengaluru dropped to 646 on Saturday with eight deaths reported, according to official data. The city also recorded 1,901 daily coronavirus recoveries and a positivity rate of 2.25%, data showed. The number of active containment zones in the city has dropped to 18, with Bommanahalli having the highest at 10, data also showed.

155.title: 2 dead, 3 injured as speeding Mercedes car rams into moving truck in Delhi
155.article_body: Two men died and three sustained grievous injuries after the Mercedes car they were travelling in crashed into the rear-end of a moving truck on a flyover in Delhi's Palam on Saturday, police said. The car's occupants, aged between 19 and 21, were returning from a wedding in Faridabad. CCTV cameras are being checked to identify and trace the truck.

156.title: 2 killed, 5 hurt in multi-vehicle crash on Pune-Mumbai Expressway
156.article_body: Two people were killed and five others were injured after a trailer truck lost control and crashed into four cars before turning turtle on the Pune-Mumbai Expressway on Saturday. The two deceased are the driver and cleaner of the trailer truck, an official said. The injured people have been rushed to hospitals in Khopoli and Navi Mumbai.

157.title: Youth caught for 'dangerously wheeling' in B'luru, police share video
157.article_body: Bengaluru police officer Savitha S took to Twitter to share video of youth balancing his scooter on one wheel on city roads. "Wheeling dangerously becomes a nightmare to the youngster after being caught by RT Nagar Police today on CBI Road," officer wrote. In another post, she wrote, "The accused youngster caught while dangerously wheeling by RT Nagar Police today."

158.title: Voting underway for all Punjab Assembly seats, 59 UP Assembly seats
158.article_body: Voting for the third phase of UP Assembly elections, in 59 seats, began at 7 am on Sunday, while polling in Punjab started at 8 am. Among the prominent faces contesting in Punjab are CM Charanjit Singh Channi, Navjot Singh Sidhu, Bhagwant Mann, Amarinder Singh, Parkash Singh Badal and Sukhbir Singh Badal. In UP,  Akhilesh Yadav is contesting from Karhal.

159.title: Hyderabad Police issues warning about 'fraudulent' Hyperverse app
159.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday warned people about the Hyperverse app which it said was a "fraudulent app". The police posted a warning on its Twitter page, which read, "Do not invest in Hyperverse app with the greed of making easy money...If you invest, you will be cheated." It also shared Telangana Cybercrime center's helpline number -1930.

160.title: European Union is open to crypto but with regulation: Top official
160.article_body: The European Union is open to cryptocurrencies including Bitcoin or a digital euro but regulations must be strengthened first, said Ylva Johansson, the Commissioner for Home Affairs. Johansson said she's not uncomfortable with digital currencies but they need to be regulated in a proper way, adding that criminal organisations mustn't be allowed to exploit the anonymity allowed by some networks.

161.title: Govt to create equity fund for startups with 20% limited stake: MoS IT
161.article_body: The government will create an equity fund for startups with a 20% limited stake, the Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said at an event conducted by the Confederation of Indian Industry. The fund will be managed by private fund managers, Chandrasekhar said, adding that "this will create required private equity capital as an addition to what exists today".

162.title: Bengal Guv returns CM Mamata's recommendation to convene assembly
162.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday said he has returned CM Mamata Banerjee's recommendation to summon State Assembly from March 7. In a tweet, Dhankhar said that the recommendation was being returned for "constitutional compliance". He added the recommendation wasn't made by the state Cabinet as per the norm. He also attached a letter he wrote to the government.

163.title: President Kovind to review Naval Fleet at Visakhapatnam on Feb 21
163.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind, who is also the Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces, will be reviewing the Naval Fleet on February 21 at Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam. The fleet will include over 60 ships and submarines and 55 aircraft. The President's Yacht, an indigenously built Naval Offshore Patrol Vessel named INS Sumitra, will lead the presidential column in the review.

164.title: It has upset me: Shatrughan Sinha on Punjab CM's 'bhaiye' remark
164.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha has said that Punjab Chief Minister Charanjit Singh Channi's 'UP, Bihar de Bhaiye' remark has upset him. He tweeted, "Being a Bihari Babu, it hasn't just upset me but hurt many people from other states, UP, Bihar and Delhi too." He added that being a public figure the CM "must know how to conduct himself".

165.title: Man drowns himself over harassment by wife & in-laws in Rajasthan
165.article_body: A 28-year-old man died by suicide by jumping into a pond on Saturday after allegedly being harassed by his wife and in-laws in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district. The deceased also recorded a testimony in a video before jumping into the Ransagar pond, Sadar Police Station SHO Hazarilal said. A case has been registered under Section 174 of the CrPC.

166.title: Iran ready for immediate prisoner swap with US: Foreign Minister
166.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian on Saturday said that Iran is ready for an immediate swap of prisoners with the US. "We believe prisoner swaps is a humanitarian issue...unrelated to the nuclear accord," he added. He further said that the West would be to blame if the ongoing talks in Vienna to revive the 2015 nuclear deal fail.

167.title: EU sends emergency medical equipment to Ukraine amid border crisis
167.article_body: The European Commission on Saturday said that the European Union (EU) has delivered emergency medical equipment to Ukraine following a request from the Ukrainian government. So far emergency aid has come from France, Romania, Slovenia, Ireland and Austria, the Commission added. The request was made amid rising fears of an imminent Russian invasion of Ukraine.

168.title: Actor's innings longer than a star's: Bobby on 45 years in B'wood
168.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol, who has completed 45 years in Bollywood, has said that an actor's innings is longer than a star's if the work is appreciated. "Hard work and focus have brought me here today. I have evolved with time," he said. Bobby made his acting debut in 1977 as a child artiste in 'Dharam Veer'.

169.title: Alliance with SP will win over 300 seats in UP: Shivpal Yadav
169.article_body: Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party (Lohiya) chief Shivpal Yadav on Saturday said their coalition with Samajwadi Party will win over 300 seats in UP. He added, "BJP will get to know the reality on March 10."  Further, talking about Karhal seat from where his nephew and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav is contesting, he said there is no competition there with BJP.

170.title: Liverpool beat Norwich, Arsenal beat Brentford in Premier League
170.article_body: Liverpool on Saturday beat Norwich 3-1 in the Premier League, with Arsenal beating Brentford 2-1. Crystal Palace lost 0-1 to third-place Chelsea. Liverpool cut Manchester City's lead at the top of the Premier League table to six points. Elsewhere, Brighton were beaten 0-3 by Burnley and Southampton beat Everton 2-0. West Ham United drew 1-1 with Newcastle United.

171.title: I, as a woman who wears hijab, resent women being harassed: Zaira on hijab controversy
171.article_body: Zaira Wasim, speaking on hijab controversy, said, "The inherited notion of hijab being a choice is an ill informed one. It's often either a construct of convenience or ignorance." "A woman who wears hijab is fulfilling an obligation enjoined upon her by the God she loves...I, as a woman who wears hijab, resent...women...being...harassed for merely carrying out...religious commitment," she added.

172.title: Didn't ask for it, don't want it: Vishvas after getting 'Y' category security
172.article_body: After he was given 'Y' category security by the Centre, former AAP leader Kumar Vishvas said, "Neither [did I ask] for 'Y' category security nor do I want it." He added, "I have not received any message from authorities about the security. It is the work of the agencies and government to think about the security of their citizens."

173.title: Some businesses I invested in had terrible products: Shark Tank's Ghazal
173.article_body: Ghazal Alagh of 'Shark Tank India' has said certain businesses that she invested in turned out to have terrible products. "There have been deals where you...loved their products, but then you...checked those products [on internet] and you go like, 'What do you do now'," she said.
